p1Ra9pwk-RmRM020Y8XWiw.text: I had my second Choolaah experience this weekend and though there were some frustrating moments, I will still be going back.   First off the frustrations: We went Sunday afternoon for a late lunch (1:30ish). The line was long and there were a limited numbers of cashiers. We waited in line a good 15 minutes to order. We both agreed that we would use order ahead on our next visit.   Now here is where my frustration is mixed. Part of the reason the line was moving so slow is that cashiers were guiding customers through the menu in such excruciating depth that orders were taking multiple minutes to put in. One cashier actually brought samples of each masala to a group of four so they could taste before ordering. While I appreciate the commitment to customer service and satisfaction, this was frustrating to watch. I would rather see samples be given in a separate location so customers can make informed decisions before standing in line.   Now for the actual food: On my first visit I got the Perfect Balance bowl with Tikka and Lamb. It was exceptional. The lamb was perfectly cooked and the sauce was the perfect pairing. On my most recent visit I ordered the Choolaah salad with Salmon. I wouldn't normally order salmon at a fast casual restaurant, but the strength of my first visit encouraged something out of the ordinary. It was quite good, though not as a good as the Perfect Balance. (Note that this is probably due to the fact that I rarely, if ever, feel fully satisfied after a fish meal.)  Overall Choolaah is great. Its ordering system is a little slow (definitely consider ordering ahead!), but that can be worked out.

PnWbOzX4H2sNNYULKq3J5w.text: A great place for awesome, locally sourced, homemade Indian food. Choolaah features a variety of menu items that satisfy the vegan, vegetarian, or carnivore in your life and takes service to a whole new level. The staff are incredibly attentive and have separate areas for you to order and pick up your food. Have doubts about what's in your dish? Have no fear, you can watch them make it! The kitchen is surrounded by a glass wall and allows you perfect vision into the food they are preparing for you. They are also incredibly knowledgeable about all of the ingredients in each dish and can assist you in choosing which sauce pairs well with what.  The interior of the building is clean and modern, and has enormous windows for natural lighting. Lots of seating to choose from, including an upstairs balcony. They are also BYOB friendly, so have a go at pairing your favorite beverage with your favorite meal! You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OOG7822y__A-meJvHaJaoA.text: So very good.  You could smell the aroma from down the street. It draws you in and even though the line was long on opening day this was definitely worth it.  The space is bright and open. There is a lot of space and 2 floors of seating. The kitchen is open and the large tandoori ovens are on display.   The food is very good we both went with the choolaah salad. One lamb meatball and one salmon. The salad was delicious fresh crunchy veggies, shredded panneer cheese, grilled califlower, golden raisins and a ginger dressing. I do wish there was a bit more cheese as it was minimal at best. The lamb was well spiced and tender. The salmon was was smokey from the grill. It was good if a little bit overcooked.  We also got the samosa chaat. Crunchy potato samosas with the mint yogurt sauce and crunchy noodles on top. We tried all of the sauces spicy mango, mint ginger, and apple tamarind we're my favorite. We tried the mint ginger lemonade and the mango lemonade too. Both were very good and refreshing.   They also have online ordering and Uber eats delivery.

OfOosfXf6YhLUadsj2D6TQ.text: Choo laah is amazing. If you like Indian food, this is the place to go. There are so many menu options to choose from, and every time you could get something wildly different and still be immensely satisfying.  As a chicken tikka masala fan, I was NOT disappointed. Everything - from the rice to the slight char on the chicken to the amount of sauce - was perfect. The naan was also especially delicious - try dipping it in one of their various sauces (I love the mango one!)  If you're a mango fan, you MUST try the mango lemonade. It's worth it, for sure.  The people there are also awesome as well. I said it was my first time, and I was offered a sample of all of the 5 curries along with the lemonades and mango lassi. They really know their hospitality!  The price is a little bit expensive (~$10 for a protein with rice and a sauce and naan) but it's worth it. Everything is locally sourced and natural, and you can definitely taste the difference.

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Tm43GFDRbU4UlVeOOe6kUg.text: Unfortunately I'm back to update my previous raving review of this place..what was one of my fav Indian restaurants in the city has not been delivering for the last few times we have been ordering. This place had been my go to for a few months but off late the food quantity has considerably reduced (like a tablespoon of dal when you order it on side? Really choolaah?) and so has the quality - food just doesn't taste the same. What makes it worse is that they don't follow instructions even when requested even in person. It's a decent place but after terrible experiences 3 times in a row I have to say that I'm really disappointed and will probably not be heading back to the restaurant anytime soon.

9VF08_UNJVIhDeaKKBBvvw.text: I was pleased overall with Choolaah.  The menu was a bit overwhelming but after we stared at it for a while we got the hang of it. We went for the signature bowls. I ordered the Choolaah bowl with veggie croquettes, basmati rice, greens and chickpea Masala.  The spices of the masala were balanced and delicious. The veggie croquettes were also delicious and had a nice spicy kick.  The wait staff was very nice and welcoming. I would definitely go back.

LBMH067jwhB6opyW1rpauA.text: Came here for a soft opening and I was really impressed.  The interior looks nice and there's plenty of seating because they have an upstairs as well.  The service was excellent and my order came out in under 5 minutes.  Now onto the food, I got a lamb tikka masala power bowl, naan on the side, and mango lassi.  The mango lassi was very refreshing, the only thing I'd say is that it could be a bit colder.  The lamb came with white rice and vegetables, everything was seasoned perfectly.  The game changer was really the sauces that they have on the side.  I tried every single one and they all were delicious and complemented the lamb amazingly.  I will definitely be back to try other things when they officially open.  Lamb tikka masala: 9/10

9kWDio-d7FVmY9GidExTDQ.text: Mediocre at best. Came in on Tuesday evening to find a relatively long line, 15 minute wait. We ordered a chicken and veggie wrap and it takes another 10 minutes before it's ready. I don't care so much about the prep time, but the product that I got was a cold mess.... Yes, cold. The cauliflower and peas were around room temperature.   The wraps were small and very lackluster. The naan didn't wow us, tasted like what you get at the store. The portions were small, so when part of the broken wrap (yes, the middle of my wrap was broken off) fell on me and onto the floor, I almost cried because each bite counts. The taste is a bad fusion take on Indian food, not the flavors and spices you find in real India cuisine.  Not as fast casual as you'd think. Maybe after the hype, it'll be less of a line and zoo inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is the wrap as it came. Messy, broken, and cold.
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SbME1yf0Ax_NNBhi4ZmMiQ.text: Believe the hype! This place lived up to the hype and beyond.   First of all, they have made such great use of the space. You come inside and it is bright, clean, and open. The kitchen is totally visible from the dining area, including the massive ovens cooking up all kinds of deliciousness. Free parking for 45 mins in the garage next door is a huge bonus.  The ordering process is generally smooth, but the menu can be confusing at first, so you'll probably need to take a few minutes in line to figure out what you want and how to order it. Dont be deterred by the lines. I'm sure the lines will move faster as people figure out how to order.  Now, about the food (obviously the most important part). I got a chicken masala bowl with basmati rice and chick pea masala and a side of Naan. I dare say it may have been the best meal I've ever had for 10 bucks. The chicken was so incredibly juicy (it's Bell and Evans!!!) and covered in a heavenly blend of spices. The chickpea masala had the perfect amount of kick to it. When mixed with the rice the entire bowl became a hearty and unbelievably satisfying meal. I scooped up every bite with the rest of the naan. I will be back again very soon. This place is amazing.

DDPUJwR5-n2VQEReRetazQ.text: Place is popular with my friends; major error in Grub-Hub delivery was eventually made right by their manager but unfortunately not in a timely manner. I think he is going to work hard to make things better with communicating with their customers to avoid errors in the future and I thank him for that. He did not ask me to edit my review.

68xgJiMon9G6jQ9Ypwgosg.text: I usually order from there when I am at work because it's so close and I can just walk there. I always get the lamb wrap and samosa. It's so good and the sauces they use is killer. The staff are friendly and smiling which is always a plus

3TmjiACjme0GH5Am7DT9Fw.text: This place is awesome. The line was a bit crazy on peak hours but likely due to opening weekend. Amazingly authentic and quality food. I'd avoid the the samosas, they were terribly disappointing but the bowls were so fucking good that I'm still giving them 5 stars. Also, the wraps were not enough food for a meal but they were excellent as well. The crew was energetic and friendly.

ardKDum6AvZ3kYPapVuIRg.text: Love this place, the hospitality of the staff with delicious food makes it for a great experience most Indian places lack!

JnOH9SEtiL4YpvSBl-DzHA.text: Solid quick Indian. Don't go their expecting the experience  of a regional Indian restaurant with many options. Great healthy options for a quick bite for lunch or a casual weeknight dinner.

xQ3CIradmnYdaTgsWBkMag.text: Wonderful concept and fun atmosphere. Kewl to watch them cook. The mango lemonade was divine

ZrsywSAO8zWRt6rg0BFPxw.text: Tried the chicken wrap with the tamarind apple and the spicy mango sauces. Was so so good. One wrap didn't fill me up so had to go back and get another one. Granted I was starving.

6HZc4rLKbEY5VkunAAW3ZA.text: I'm officially a Choolaah head. I almost always get the Samosa Chat...it might be one of my all time favorite foods. I also really enjoy their Pav Bhaji, which is like an Indian sloppy Joe. Pile it high with onions and squeeze some lemon on top, and I feel like I'm back in India!

vYkKDcbRSAoeXVg_UGyM_g.text: Pretty tasty food that comes out pretty quick! Tons of options are available, which allows a lot of room for customizability. Tons of vegetarian options too, which I love. Honestly, my only complains are that it's a little overpriced, and that they need to change the music that they play inside (it's not great).

W6o8RpD3xWp3jyichG9Rvw.text: Good atmosphere and really helpful employees. I am not an expert with Indian food, but I thought theirs was tasty. Especially for a counter service restaurant.

Kv5KVQD5tfm2t9NFfmmyyg.text: The Tikka Masala in the protein bowl was amazing. This is a very modern restaurant. The creativity is so out of the box. I enjoyed this a lot  We got the food very quickly. Also, the fact that we can see the food being cooked is also amazing. There was probably a lot of thought that went into this. The moment I walked in I was amazed. My daughter loves the swing right in the front.

iPsKf06b4Xm_QVCkaKrWRg.text: This is a great addition to the neighborhood. Choolaah offers a wide variety of quick, Indian options at an affordable price in a fun environment. The tikka masala was great with the available sauces and the chicken was very juicy. The naan was also great with some crisp garlic on it. Choolaah also offers many vegetarian options. To top it off, the owners were interested and engaged with customers to make sure it was a good fit.

gh_6IHVDaxThi09sXtDk-A.text: I really don't understand the whole buzz around this place. There are so many better more authentic Indian food in Pittsburgh.  I found this place busy, slow, over-priced and not tasty food.  I don't think I will really go back again.  Even tho that I really appreciate the lady who took my order who was super nice and friendly.  I would say that was my only positive experience there.

FaVqmJNciZVfR0hpv94DCA.text: Pittsburgh has good Indian population but not a good Indian food. I ve been searching for a good one for a while now. This is by far the best Indian food in Pittsburgh. Its open kitchen style, menu with combo choices, modern set up and ambeince makes this the best. But the best part of it is the taste is really good.. as close as a good homecooked Indian meal.

L9IedR0fyX1Pa6mvVEeM4w.text: Stuff here tastes great! The lamb is amazing, and the biryani has a great crust. The food here does not lack in flavor at all. I have no complaints!

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Biryani

6s0Xg-SVyS_jLL2y4oKbqw.text: Creative, fun, unique! Food was great and served up quick. Staff was informative and friendly. A welcomed addition to foodie neighborhood of East Liberty.

SYJRcoaQN1kBkEQHR15fmg.text: Food was excellent, reasonable with a friendly staff. the atmosphere is awesome. the decorations are awesome. I like watching the chefs cook.

SAEZv1bJ4gN-j5C4Iz_S3g.text: I love the food there and the people who work there are friendly. The tikka masala bowl is awesome and filling

78-wrz1VBsGf4ZkdQlx0gg.text: Choolaah is the Chipotle-equivalent of Indian BBQ. It is a great fast-casual place to get Indian food, which can be hard to find in Pittsburgh. There is free 45-minute parking on site, which is also hard to find. I am knocking one star off for the price. Expect to spend $15/person if you dine in and get a drink, which is somewhat steep for fast casual. That being said, the food is delicious, and Choolaah definitely is near the top on my list when I'm looking for a fast-casual meal.

yo42xINGpwS5a3XaXH7t_g.text: A welcome addition to the East End!  Love this concept of an Indian Chipotle.  The menu may seem overwhelming when you first arrive but the staff is so friendly and helpful so be sure to ask. Order at the counter and your food is served quickly at the next counter over. They have plenty of seating including an upstairs.   I highly recommend starting off with the mango lemonade-it is so tasty.  You have bowls, wraps and numerous sides to choose from for your entree. The food is filing and more than enough. I always stick with the bowl with either white or brown rice topped with the black lentil daal and for my protein the paneer.  You also have lamb, chicken and numerous other meats to choose from. I have been to India a few times and the paneer at Choolaah is as authentic as you can get. Don't forget to upgrade to include a side of naan bread topped with butter and garlic. It is to die for!  If you still have room for dessert they have ice cream and I recommend the mango.

7Z7soeev3pzU0LhQp9zZ9A.text: Right from the start we were greeted warmly. The gentleman who waited on us gave us a tour of the menu and even gave us a sampling of their different masala sauces. We also got an appetizer the samosas. They were wonderful and although fried weren't greasy. We each had lamb meatballs as our protein and my version came with the tandoori veggies. Definitely will be coming back!!!

1zxZ6ivmLynUE6X7Lc5C7w.text: Choolaah is very UNIQUE to say the least.  You can build a meal, create a bowl, or simply stop by for a container of the most flavorful "masalas"... the plentiful portions are not just filling they are scrumptiously delicious.  The Samosa Chaat is like a burst of crispy potato filled goodness topped with cream yogurt drizzle and a perfect noodle crunch.  The lamb meatballs scream " one in a million", and the Paneer wrap is quite CHEEZY(believe me).  Well I can't wrap up without mentioning what I think should be considered the CHOOLAAH STAPLE, the Naan.  They make the naan bread right there in your face, it comes out piping hot and warms the soul.

s6DuZUALDeswfzKmJb9jXQ.text: We really enjoyed our first Choolah experience and will go back soon. The food is good and fresh and simply prepared so you can add complexity with the sauces. We got the Perfect Balance Bowl with Tofu, the Lamb Meatball wrap, the black bean daal and a naan. This was a pretty good amount of food, but the bowl was a little small. Next time we'll try the biryani which looked great. I would recommend the chai if you're familiar with the version of this you'll actually get in India (and is very rare in the US) -- but you will want to add a couple sugar packets. The lemonades looked amazing and we'll be sure to try them next time. So as someone who's spent some time in India and been looking for good Indian ever since, I'd recommend it, particularly as a lighter take on Indian flavors.

4l4C83jGuWN4ixSmfvw54A.text: I really like this place. It is basically the chipotle of indian food. Everything is really clean, really organized, and there's a diverse cast of employees. It's not a traditional family owned sit-down place... much more like a chipotle than a "restaurant" and I didn't really like their lamb meatballs so I can't really give it 5 stars but the chicken BBQ was terrific, the paneer wrap was also really good, and their mango lemonade it phenomenal. 4 stars seems right.

G4Lp39o5HcBHJs2Na4cK8A.text: Vegetarian and vegan friendly! And not only friendly, but multiple options. Consistently good service and quality, return at least once a week!

94QQ8Z5C6XbsMTHg_m7bTw.text: Choolaah is pretty much the Chipotle of Indian food--once you know that, you're good.   The space has a lot of simple tables and booths for seating both on the first floor and the second with a "sauce" station and an interesting queue of tablet stations where staff take orders.  The staff friendliness and engagement with the menu is definitely a high point here. Staff will walk new guests through the process of selecting/building different bowls and will even offer samples to help guests make decisions. Staff seem knowledgeable about the sourcing of ingredients.  Prices are reasonable and the menu is diverse, vegetarian friendly, and all of the items we tried were fairly high quality for fast casual dining. There are things, like the nan and samosas, which were a little disappointing if you are someone who regularly frequents some of the Indian restaurants in Pittsburgh. But the bowls where you get to pick your protein, add-ins, and sauce were a great idea and made it easy for everyone to enjoy their favorite. They have great flavored lemonades, which is something different, and some "street snacks," like the pav bhaji, which they describe as a vegetarian sloppy joe. Not something I've seen elsewhere!  It's been super crowded every single time I've been in there and when it's humming at max capacity it's pretty loud and can get a bit messy. Parking is a pain, but if you're sure you can get in and out in under 45, the garage next door is free.

mvq2BG_06Yx6clq7jRSHRg.text: This is going to be my new favorite restaurant in PITTSBURGH. I did a delivery so the food was a tad cold and the curry was mixed with rice due to how it was packed in one bowl. But even then the taste and flavors were the best of any Indian restaurant in US. Outstanding meal, I had paneer and veggie BBQ with rice and tikka masala - finish was top notch.

bgOXr8qlVMbwwPm4NiEHSw.text: I love choolah! The employees are so kindhearted and bubbly, the food was fresh, and the environment was great. They even have an outdoor area for eating if it's nice and sunny out.

EKkkn8VrWWmER5I9Z53kqw.text: Love! So many different way to fix your meal. Bonus points for offering so many vegetarian options. The sauces are key. Customer service is excellent.

SSLRRehjQWMEGOhBvh9ToA.text: Choolah has a variety of spices and sauces to choose from they never disappoint. The staff is excellent very attentive, knowledgeable and very pleasant.

79HuQwp3hkBUUUZKnkEnbQ.text: So many great options here. I've tried many things - the tikka masala with lamb, the veggie croquettes, many of their wraps - and liked all of the various options. In fact I would order many things on their menu again.  Even better are their "snacks" - the samosa chaat is phenomenal and the pav bhavi (think and Indian sloppy joe) was excellent.   The kids also like the options on the childrens' menu, especially the naan pizzas.  Finally, recommend both the mango and mint lemonades.  We've been multiple times in Pittsburgh and have always had a good experience.

It4ifMzNm5K95MWndIugUg.text: Food and service was good. Set up and dining sort of feels like Chipotle, so good option for something quick and casual.

Z1FF8DAY7mKyx4K1VvmLIQ.text: I loved this place with their different varieties of curries and toppings. The place has a really good ambience and trendy Indian stuff like stack of books stacked for about 50 feet I guess. The food tasted good and with top notch quality.

bUldmdKiiINDVb79ot_veA.text: New fav place to eat. Their food is so wonderful! They let you try all the different masalas sauces, special drinks they make daily. Trying new food can be a bit much for some people, so getting to try before you buy is PERFECT! Free parking, quick cook time, great location. #winning You can even watch them cook your food, I find that awesome.

DHiQ2bkF0X6NiDM4yg3Dvg.text: I finally found my jam in the Burgh! I've lived here for 4 years and have missed a good Indian restaurant. I'm not looking for anything fancy here, just simple fare, made well that I can count on to hit the right buttons on the nights I don't feel like cooking after a hard days work. Boom! Choolaah gets it bang on! They don't have an extensive menu. A few simple dishes, done right.. with the flexibility to ratch up the heat or not if you're like me. I was in heaven! Paneer - mmmm.. Chana - ohh yeahhh.. Dal - oh my god yes! .. you get my drift.. lol! The Naan is delightfully light and fresh.. it really is the next best thing to eating in a Punjabi home. Don't miss their sauce/chutney station. Oh and the kulfi! I loved their decor too.. and their "hand wash o matic" gets them extra points coz of course, you're gonna get in there with your hands and lick the curry off your fingers one by one.

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Samosa chaat
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pav bhaji

FHqapkjzO9q5hFD7B3GSNg.text: High quality, freshly made, quick, tasty, and good service. What more could you ask for? I haven't had much Indian food in Pittsburgh but this place really hits the nail on the head. Great new fast casual option for the east end and Pittsburgh as a whole!

_CvIxcbiftd9lII8PeXHWA.text: We had high expectations for Choolaah but were very disappointed. First, the portions are very small. For $8-12 per meal we expected to leave full and that was not the case. I ordered a chicken dish and it was pretty slimy. Almost seemed undercooked. My favorite part of the meal was the $1.25 nan that I added on to my meal. 3 stars for fast service and decent sauces, but I won't be going back.

nRtWujMe1jEqqIFNQuBBog.text: It was a little intimidating when I came in to order, but once I figured out how it worked, it was awesome! I chose a bowl with veggies and tikka masala. We also got the samosas. Indian food is my fave and to have a place like this where it's quick makes it even better.  A really great additional to the Pittsburgh food scene.

U8kIQwaLFj8562MFLjWQIg.text: If you are looking for extremely Americanized Indian food this is for you. There is no spice to be had in any of the food. I feel that even though this is supposed to be Indian fast food it could have been way better executed. My food was cold even the naan bread which was supposed to be freshly made. I love Indian food and their food makes me sad. I will never return to this horrible restaurant.

iOoz9apoJrQYS_haDQS0lw.text: I want.one of these in Milwaukee. Like, yesterday.   My boss and I ordered delivery after she talked it up. It did not disappoint. I cant tell you if the food was better than more traditional Indian takeout, but I did like the panera/chipotle approach to building bowls, customizing what goes in them and the add ins.   Had chicken masala bowl with half rice, half greens with additional roaster veggies and tamarind apple chutney. Mixed it all up and devoured it.   I will likely keep this one on the list for work lunches whenever I'm working from the 'Burgh.

Dil213F27BOnhIYXU6WRfA.text: Great healthy quick eats! I enjoyed the atmosphere of this restaurant. I ordered the chicken Choolaah bowl with chickpea masala and one order of naan. Another person I was dinning with ordered the same think but had Tiki masala. Both was delicious and so awesome. Full flavor and you could taste the authentic Indian flavor. I washed it all down with mango lemonade.   One con that I would give this place was that they didn't have other Indian staples like garlic naan, curry butter or mango chicken, and biyarni yellow rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

RQ-zPDPuWkP0LtYyat0lXg.text: Finally decided to give Choolaah a try - and I'm really glad I did! It's a really cool concept - casual cafeteria style while also BYOB! As everyone says - it's comparable to Chipotle... build your own Indian food bowl. Each part you add to your bowl has a different cost. I tried the tikka masala with chicken and got some naan too! I thought it was delicious for a quick and reasonably priced meal.   I will also say that I felt everyone who I interacted with provided friendly service!    Will definitely return the next time I need a quick and easy meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TXbx3sIYdScel3Cz2KiB_g.text: Stumbled upon this place today and loved it! They have a variety of Indian food build your own bowls with different types of proteins, grains, and masala. I had the Perfect Balance bowl with chicken, tikka masala, and added naan. Great meal - very flavorful and loved all the different sauce options. Chicken was well cooked and veggies were good. Naan was ok, not bad but a bit dry. Mango lassi was good - would recommend.  Also think it's worth mentioning they have a cool automatic hand washing station - I've never seen this and it was super handy!

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L0P4syaQmrN-hL9dc1qSeQ.text: I wish Choolah was closer to where I live! For not being one to seek out Indian food to try, Choolah is a place I would gladly go to eat multiple times a week.   What I like about this place is that it's cheap, it reminds me of some of the authentic Indian places I've been to, the naan bread is incredible, the spice and toppings bar is excellent, and the food is very American apetite friendly for those who aren't familiar with Indian food. I like ordering the rice and masala with chicken and naan bread. Super filling and with the spice bar I like to add a nice amount of heat.   Love this place. Too bad it's so far away. We'll be back when in the area!

nsV1P6Orvp5RVtFSAFehPQ.text: Pros: Every bite is pack of flavors! Nice ambience. Free taste of the sauces for first timers. Dips are awesome. Naan bread is to die for. Food is served in a timely manner.                                                                                           Cons: Menu could be easier to follow.

MxBQ5IljdQNtBMqh_DQtgQ.text: I was honestly blown away by the flavor of the food I got at Choolaah. The chicken was moist and flavorful, and my wife's salmon was cooked perfectly. We both got the Perfect Balance bowl, and loved the veggies--they had plenty of flavor, but the spices didn't overpower any of the other flavors of the veggies themselves.  We've been meaning to try Choolaah since we moved to Pittsburgh, and we both regret not trying to sooner. This place is great--plenty of options for all dietary types (gluten, vegetarian, vegan), and a surprising variety of proteins to choose from. I can't wait to go back and try some other dishes out. I know I won't be disappointed!

X4e3-oyxTmd4cJZyuV710Q.text: I was feeling lazy and Postmates had free delivery from Choolah, so I decided to give it a try since I'd been craving Chana masala. I got the veggie perfect balance bowl: roasted veggies (sweet potatoes, zucchini, red peppers), brown rice, chickpea masala, added tofu for $5 and got some wheat naan and a side of mint yogurt. Delivered in about 45 minutes and everything was delicious and really hit my cravings. The veggies, even with the delivery time, were fresh and perfectly roasted. The masala sauce was very much to my tastes. The tofu was seasoned nicely and cooked very well. The naan was a little too soft but still not bad. I didn't need much of the mint yogurt and it was a little runnier than expected but it was good for a couple bites. Overall, with delivery it was maybe overpriced, I'd definitely want to eat in here or split a delivery with friends, it was overall pretty excellent.

CMZiWsEVL9C6DkxbNE5rYQ.text: Choolah is a fun concept that has been well executed. It's probably been said before but at the risk of oversimplifying, choolaah is kind of like a version of chipotle for Indian food. You assemble your plate from the basics of carbs (rice, naan), protein (chicken, lamb, paneer, salmon, tofu) and accompanying flavored masala (tikka masala, chickpea, lentil). On the whole, the options are great and I recommend stopping by.  Beyond the food itself, my favorite part of the meal is the different sauces available - they're unique and flavorful. The 3 I've tried (mint-yogurt, spicy mango, and tamarind apple) are delicious. Also, if you've never tried Indian ice cream  I highly recommend trying the malai or mango kulfi at least once! It's the stuff dreams are made of - well, if you have a sweet tooth like me.

H3nHuA6_-35C08A-bhLBcw.text: A great addition to the Pittsburgh food scene! The restaurant has open feeling to it because of the large windows and is very aesthetically pleasing. The menu is a bit daunting upon first glance because it has so many options and you don't necessarily know what will pair well together. Good news is that you couldn't go wrong with any decision you make because all of the food is delicious!   During my first visit, I was offered a sampler of the various sides, which was very generous and helped me to make up my mind for the order. I usually get the build a bowl and choose either paneer or the veggie croquette as my protein. I've also tried all of the sides on separate occasions and they are all equally good--if I had to choose, I'd say I'm partial to the tikka masala.   The samosas are pretty tasty and make for a great snack. And the mango lassi is just okay. Overall, Choolaah is a great place to get quick Indian food.

EmNk2GxzCM_djhc7jweJHw.text: I never knew what "Choolaah" meant until my dad who was visiting explained to me it's what you call the brick stove you make tandoori in! My favorite part about Choolaah is the charred taste from the choolaah stove on the meat and paneer. Choolaah is my go-to whenever I am working from home. They are always quick (if not early) with the delivery and the food is so flavorful and authentic. My favorite is the perfect paneer bowl. The paneer is charred and has the authentic taste. Furthermore, there is so much in one bowl, it lasts me 3 day!

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. HUGE cubes of flavorful paneer in my rice bowl *drool*

lDVVm4B40kEQMv56544Ngg.text: Choolaah is a fantastic addition to East Liberty.   The food is delicious and the atmosphere is great. You're paying for quality ingredients and fresh food. I've had the lamb, salmon, and chicken and all were fantastically cooked and had tons of flavor. Their sauce bar is also great. Lots to choose from! The freshly made drinks pair great with the food.   They offer free 45 minute parking in the lot by their restaurant. There's paid street parking nearby if you need more time.   We also ordered catering from Choolaah and people loved the food. There was a slight timing mixup but they quickly fixed it when contacted!

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb tikka masala bowl; 5/5 stars
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon tikka masala (with a stolen lamb meatball); 5/5 stars

sXXkeZ3a9t7-zzANk6ViBg.text: Very good food, lots of options on the menu, cool space to sit down and eat, fast service & fresh ingredients. The portions are good, but I'm not sure the price is always justified (depending on what exactly you order). Fun sauces & juices too. Glad I work close by to be able to eat here for lunch once in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

w4bZr6EUjpfjSBgKfHLuWg.text: I eat here too much. Tasty, filling food and it is affordable to eat as a single person...lots of Indian restaurants you have to order family style for dinner. My favorite is the paneer with Tikka marsala and honestly the plentiful and free 45 minute parking in the garage next door is a huge draw too.

_Pa5Wxt_wFelW714VGkeOA.text: Great menu variety and quality of food! I tried the ginger lemonade (would highly recommend) and tikka masala with paneer and rice and naan. The tikka masala was very flavorful and paired well with the paneer but was more enjoyable when I cut the paneer up into much smaller pieces. Also, the naan was a bit dry so I'd stick to the main entrees in the future. Excited to try the other protein options next time.  Although the menu can be overwhelming, the staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. High ceilings, bright lights, and tasteful decor also added to the trendy ambience of this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Choolaah Indian BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ginger lemonade, Tikka masala with paneer and rice, and naan

8tOXcC8hqaEeoTqzWk7RLQ.text: Good place to hang out with a group of friends or have a silent lunch or dinner just by yourself. I was here with a bunch of friends over a weekend lunch. There was a big line and we had to wait for almost 15 minutes to get to the front of the line. Interiors are interesting enough to keep you occupied for 5-10 minutes. And the extra time can be spent trying to understand the menu and figuring out how to place the order.   The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful in helping us understand the process to place the order. We got tikka masala with chicken and masala bowl with chick pea and rice. The flavors are subtle and toned down to suit less spicy palate. The bowls come in appropriate quantities. All the masalas are served over rice. So, you can either mix it all together before you start eating or you can mix it as you go. Ginger mint lemonade is the best drink to have on the side while you eat the warm comfort food.   I recommend this place if you are looking for some toned down spices yet flavorful Indian food fare!

Zfk2xlYIf_9V18SABzNrEA.text: I'm going to put this as simply as I can: GO TO CHOOLAAH! From the moment I walked into this place I felt a vibe that you don't get from a fast food place in Pittsburgh. The menu was extensive but not overwhelming. The service was helpful but not forceful. The portions were plentiful but not gluttonous.   I've never been to such a rapid paced restaurant that was still entirely focused on the customer. Someone who's never had Indian could easily create a flavorful, delicious dish. I highly recommend a Choolaah bowl with tandoori veggies.   In short, I will be returning in the near future and looking to make myself a regular here. I promise you will not be disappointed. I could go on and on but actions speak louder than words and Choolaah screams perfection!

byzNjFO0K-IjXlY7cfv2Rw.text: Oh my goodness! What a great addition to Pittsburgh food scene! I have been secretly hoping for a great fast casual Indian restaurant and it looks like my prayer has finally been answered:) Besides awesome food, the place has a hip decor and feels spacious. I have tried their paneer and chicken bowls and both are to die for. They source their paneer (indian cottage cheese) from Amish farms and its one of the smoothest I have ever tasted. Chicken and paneer are bbqd to perfection in their tandoor ovens and you can add grains/salad/condiments of your choice to make a wholesome meal. But choose your sauces wisely as a couple of them are pretty hot. I haven't stopped thinking of Choolah's food since past few weeks and that means another trip to Shadyside! Yayy!

TJZAYUsvXE46tZT2BU3qpQ.text: LOVE Choolaah. First had it in Cleveland and was so happy when they opened in Pittsburgh. Lots of vegan options. I always do the somosas (AMAZING) and the chickpea masala bowl. Their naan is great as well. They are always super busy so recommend ordering online if you want take out. Great fast casual food!

mr8xT8YFDzGBov0EXiXHqg.text: Great organic Indian food and phenomenal mango lassi's. Great friendly decor and truly fast food. I'll certainly return to Choolah for more fantastic Indian food.

nT33SMDeKf5SqyBxnpxigQ.text: Indian fast-casual?! Can't be beat. The decor for this place is very cool. You sort of walk in and need to take a few minutes to look around. Ordering can be a bit overwhelming when you literally want to try everything, so go with a friend so you can order a few things and split. Our cashier was very friendly and helpful when we made out decisions and he even chatted with us about culture, which mean he enjoys what he is doing! We ordered a Lassi, Choolah Salad with Chicken, Naan, the  "Veggie Sloppy Joe" type appetizer, and the black Lentils with Rice. The Salad had to be my favorite with the Indian-style Ranch dressing (which is more flavorful than the other dressing). It had chickpeas, pickled onions and roasted cauliflower, which made it unique. The Mango Lassi was good, but not as refreshing as I would have thought. It was my first experience so I am happy I tried it. The place is really clean and everyone is smiling. Parking was easy in the lot next door. We paid just $5 for 2+ hours. I will definitely be back to try some more items!

i2nHtICDLEI6718j3aIdcw.text: Fast food Indian - what?!?!?  Amaze-balls.  That's this place.  The tikka masala with paneer and brown rice, with a side of veggie balls is my typical order.  The paneer is either rubbed or marinated in the perfect blend of spices.  The tikka sauce is mild, and well flavored.  Oh, wait!  The naan!!!!  Salty, herby, soft, perfection!  Such a wonderful place.  Make the trip.  You won't be sorry!

MLt9EAVy7z20LEy95GusyQ.text: Great place to grab'n'go with some quality Indian food. Everything is made fresh and the taste of their spice mix is amazing! w-nWzWK1aS3PYWzu7o92uw.text: loved the concept of fast Indian food, but I was hesitant. Could Indiana food really be served this way? qY24m1_o3umQGBwxbVCtIw.text: Oh my! This is my fav lunch spot while working nearby. Everything I have ordered has always been delicious and hearty. I especially like the paneer cheese and naan. I will warn you it ain't cheap for lunch. My favorite meal comes to 13.62. Ouch! This consists of a fountain drink, naan, and a protein bowl of paneer, white rice, and tikka masala. d19QI5GEUQSsfa4CVdfBmQ.text: To be clear: I still love Choolah's quirky take on fast-casual Indian food and think it's an excellent addition to the area. I've been here enough to see that the quality and taste haven't changed over time. With that said, the execution and the way things are managed onsite, particularly during peak hours, needs a second look.  When Choolah first came on the scene you could order pickup or delivery directly from their website. Most of the focus seemed to be on in-person guests or ordering online from a single source and picking up from the restaurant. With this in mind, I sent my boyfriend to pick us up some dinner last night. He arrived with the online order having already been placed. Give past experiences I assured him it wouldn't take long. Boy was I mistaken!  A full twenty-five minutes after our order was scheduled to be picked up (and after forty minutes of total wait time) he was called to the counter to be told that they'd run out of all naan bread and he was not to receive the chicken wrap he'd wanted. He was given a piece of paper to fill out for "the financial department" with a vague assurance that they would look into it and probably refund us. They tossed in a couple samosas as a consolation and sent him on his way.   By my estimation, Choolah is using no less than three delivery services now, depending on your location. UberEats, GrubHub, and Postmates. I don't use DoorDash, but they're likely on there as well. I don't see an issue with offering delivery, but offering three different services significantly compounds the amount of food required to serve everyone in a way that most restaurants simply cannot handle. If you're selling, cooking, and packing food for five to ten times the amount of people your restaurant can physically accommodate, someone is going to pay the price eventually. In this case it's the customers coming into Choolah and very likely people who ordered via a third party only to have their food run out.   The thing about these delivery services is that they have no idea of current inventory or how busy a restaurant actually is. Staff are pulled between satisfying online demand and serving guests in-person. These services can be turned off during peak times or when food is running low, however there didn't seem to be anyone with the authority (or good sense) to do this last night, leaving paying customers stuck with no food and no recourse. I hope the management at Choolah takes another look at how and when they're using delivery services and adjusts accordingly. I'd hate to see a place with such potential turn into a frustrating experience for everyone!

lGpRcvVBDkkikhDW95lsQA.text: I really liked the food here. The place itself is really pretty, with colorful decor that is reflected in the flavors of their dishes. My server was super kind, and she explained to me what every kind of dish was when I told her it was my first time coming to the restaurant. Even though I'm Indian, and I knew what she was talking about, it was super helpful and nice that she did that introduction for every customer. I ordered the Chicken Choolah Bowl and the White Naan along with the Malai Kulfi. They have a lot of vegetarian options and you can customize the kind of daal (lentils) and the masala in the curry that you want, where I agree with another review that compares this place to Chipotle.  The food itself was great, with large portion sizes, and listen, I'm not gonna say if you are homesick for Indian food that you should come here (you should just probably cook it yourself) but objectively I would say it was really good Indian food! The food is spicy enough, which I loved. I would have liked to explore more options, but my friends and I enjoyed ourselves. The mango lassi is good, and they have this hand wash machine, that honestly, was the coolest part of my visit there. The veg options are available, yes, but they aren't as great (they definitely do meats better) but I would suggest you try this place out!

bDGZLgQVv_qd1y3jaiwarA.text: Was in Pittsburgh with my family for a weekend apartment hunting and we ate here TWICE it was that good. I first ate the original one in Cleveland years ago and this location was just as delicious.   It's essentially Indian chipotle but with way more options and they bring the food out to you. They have great veggie  and vegan options as well as salmon so really satisfies all food restrictions. Food is not spicy but you can add hot sauce. Is very flavorful tho.   The only thing that was so so was the cauliflower wrap - I did not love it and wouldn't get again. But chicken, lamb, tofu, salmon-- all excellent. The mango lassi is not too sweet. And the Samosas are the perfect size and are quite flavorful.  Don't forget the sauces!!   Great for a quick lunch or dinner either take out or dine in.

WMB76PZLvrfreXMSb9-ohQ.text: If you haven't been to Choolaah...why not?!  This isn't your usual Indian fare. It's fast-casual; it's customizable; and it's almost best described as a fusion between American-style dishes and Indian-inspired flavors. The result is a menu that features naan and samosa alongside chicken and salmon salads. (That said, the paneer and naan chips you can add to the salads elevate them to a whole new level, in my opinion!)  This menu is definitely Choolaah's greatest strength, especially because it's so customizable. From bowls to naan wraps to those yummy salads, everything can be made and adjusted for the average carnivore or for plant-lovers alike. Spice levels are also totally in your control when ordering. Plus, key ingredients can be swapped as needed, helping to keep a meal focused on one food group over another. It's handy in cases such as people wanting to cut down on carbs, increase their vegetable intake, eat more protein - things like that.  While I find that I don't really need anything else (everything is cooked and prepared so nicely, and I'm honestly a Plain Jane at heart), Choolaah also features a sauce station for people who want even more flavor in each bite. It's a great option to experiment with flavor profiles if that's something you like to do.   They also offer ice cream, although I've never made it to dessert here. Maybe one day...  In case you can't tell, I'm in love with this place. Their food is just so good and so unique. Everything else great about the business (like the polite, hardworking staff, as well as the fact that Choolaah periodically donates part of their Monday proceeds to specific nonprofits) is a big cherry on top of my already happy taste buds. I'll definitely be frequenting Choolaah for a while to come!

tooYhNmIKdzbXOavKNRTvg.text: Choolaah is awesome. I see the comparison to Indian chipotle thrown around a lot, and while you get to customize your bowl, it's not done in an assembly line manner.   The ingredients are all of the highest quality and the lamb, salmon, and chicken are always cooked perfectly. The sauces are all good but I prefer the tikka masala and would recommend it to someone going for the first time and unsure of what they'd like. The food is generally prepared in about 5 minutes and there is tons of room for seating downstairs or up and a station to add toppings/sauces.    Choolaah is a great spot for lunch or dinner and luckily for me is within walking distance!

zeCot6gahX27NhTCsgHWbQ.text: This is like a Chipotle-style Indian cuisine that I was blessed with when visiting Pittsburgh. This chain seriously needs to expand to other states!! Or at least, please come to LA.   They have three main types of bowls that you can choose from, depending on your preference of salad, protein, and rice. Then you choose your curry/sauce. I got the basic one - tikki masala - literally THE best. I was also craving tofu, and I literally did not go wrong with any decisioin I made. The tofu was perfect consistency, and the curry was perfect for dipping with the naan (it costs extra, but hey, can't have an indian cuisine without the naan!!). The ONLY thing I could have requested was a bit more rice. My rice was drenched in curry, making it more soupy than I would have liked, but I tend to like my rice be not as wet with sauce. It's just my preference. 10/10 would come again.

2NNL4naOx0qvWMUzsXmOmQ.text: Imagine an Indian food version of Chipotle! There are 4 "templates" of what you can order- bowl, 1/2 bowl 1/2 greens, double protein, or a salad. There are multiple protein options that include vegetarian options. They have vegan, vegetarian, and gluten free choices. Finally, the BEST part: all of the sauces and curries you can choose from. This place really advocates for unique tastes that you want in your bowl.   I got the choolah bowl with veggie croquettes which are basically falafels but with lentils rather than chickpea. Then, I chose the Tikki Masala as the curry. Ah just writing this review is making me drool! I can't wait to come back!

01H4Co2tRLtfu3AlO5Y_JA.text: Not made by Indians but still pretty great! I enjoyed the food a lot even though I didn't get the traditional Indian feeling I get at more traditional spots. sOn_McS-drGO8bLsWKBPow.text: I had this place bookmarked for a while and I just happened to see it when I was trying to find parking in East Liberty. I'm a big fan of Indian food and when I saw Choolaah I knew I had to try it. When you walk in you order at the front and you're given a buzzer that goes off when your food is ready. There is a menu when you order that shows all of the dietary restrictions of the menu items, which being vegan I always appreciate. I ordered the perfect balance bowl with tofu and the chickpea masala. There are an array of hot sauces and chutneys to choose from to go along with your meal.  My sister and I really enjoyed our meals and I like that you can now quickly get great Indian food in East Liberty. Next time I come back I definitely want to try the yellow lentil daal and the samosas.

Nyctul8T61Cm0CdvFULuRA.text: My husband and I were in town for a yelp event and had gift cards for Choolaah so we decided to swing by for dinner on our way home. Parking can be tricky in this area if you do not want to park in the parking garage, however our timing was exceptional and we found on street parking close by.   The food was just as good as I remember! I ordered the Choolaah Salad with Chicken and ginger dressing. I decided on the spicy mango sauce to enhance the flavor of the salad - it had a hint of sweetness with just enough spice to linger on your tongue.  I rarely get salads that are veggie forward but this combination is just perfect. The pickled onions add a nice crisp touch with golden raisins that provide a touch of sweetness and a texture difference. I was not a huge fan of the fried chips that came with it as they were really greasy. My husband got a side of naan bread and although I did not taste it, it looked wonderful and light, perfect for dipping into masala.   The main dishes run a little over $10 depending on the protein you decide on. The portions are a generous size, enough for me to make it two meals. I would be interested in trying a wrap as they looked fresh and filling!   If we end up in East Liberty, I have no doubt we will make another stop at Choolaah.

XocHVJpvgp4x69GDzcx5oA.text: I have been meaning to try Choolaah for a long time as I live in the area and it did not disappoint.  Great place, great service, quick if you are in a rush, or equally as wonderful if you want to sit down and make it a date night. It's perfect if you want a place that isn't too overwhelming and can allow you to sit briefly or hang out a little while.   The food was basically what I was expecting. No, I did not come here for a very traditional indian food, but rather something that will just curb that indian food craving that I have been having lately. This place was perfect for that .   I had the power bowl, with tofu and tiki masala sauce. The vegetables were perfectly cooked and the sauce was great. The tofu didn't have as much of the spices as I was expecting, so since I don't have to be eating tofu (I just enjoy it when their a lot of spices and sauces for it to soak up), I may choose a different protein next time. I also paired the bowl with some naan (so good) and mango lassi.   Overall, great first experience and I will definitely back.   Note: BYOB, they did have a cork screw at the counter that you can ask for.

ypqUISAP5ulCl7_n5Hi4yw.text: Finally got around to stopping by Choolaah and I was not disappointed. Upon walking in to the space you can see the chefs making food through a giant glass window. The smells of spices, baked goods, and seasoned meat flow all throughout the restaurant. It's a very clean place with a bright atmosphere and friendly people. There is also a hands free hand wash station which I did not use but it looks pretty cool.  The food was also great. I ordered Tikka Masala with chicken. The rice/sauce was bursting with flavor. It was on point with the some of the better Masalas I've had. The chicken was something to rave about. Fresh, flavorful, juicy, not fatty. A quality product.    I love list of where the food products are sourced from. It always feels better to know where your food is coming from before you eat.

t7wHgQzk0pANkyK-tTyCVA.text: My partner and myself got to have free samples & catering from this restaurant at a couple events that we went to.
